name: 2013 Bali Retreat
description:
Life is so full. Full of busyness, obligations, responsibilities. Lists.

This November, take time to invest in yourself. slow down and just BE in the beauty of Bali. And do yoga of course!



This retreat is for you if:
You are are looking for ways to bring self-care, self-expression, and overall wellness into your daily life
You need some time out to heal, emotionally or physically, from a big year
You know how important self-care is, and understand that a week of deep nurturing can often carry you through a year (or more) of living!
You are looking for a fun way to explore yoga
You want to deepen your existing yoga practice


When: 23 – 28 Nov 2013
Cost: AUD$1850 single or $1650 twin share.
Earlybird if paid in full by Sep 30, 2012: $1600 single, $1400 twin share.



Where: Honeymoon Guesthouses, Ubud, Bali

What you get for that:

5 nights of beautiful accommodation in the premium Sawah rooms (read: fit for a prince or princess)
Breakfast every day
Welcome dinner feast
Final night dinner feast
Designer clothing trunk show and bubbles. What an afternoon!
Optional half-day tour of the best shopping in Ubud. I’ve added this because people so enjoy the amazing designer clothing you can get in Bali, and the equally good prices.
2 gorgeous treatments: massage, facial, reflexology. You choose.
Morning and evening yoga – asana, pranayama, chanting and philosophy
A private lesson with me to work on your own particular goals or challenges. People tell me this is one of their favourite parts of the retreat.
Collection from the airport in Bali
Party pack

You will need to arrange your own flights.

To book, you will need to pay a $450 non-refundable deposit, with the balance payable in full one month before the event.

To pay your deposit, choose the ‘Deposit’ option, add it to your cart and check out. You can pay your balance in the same way, by choosing the ‘Balance’ option. Earlybird prices are available till September 30.

name: One in-home yoga class
description:
Give that special someone a really special experience: an awesome mm...Yoga! teacher will go to their home, at a time that suits them, and tailor a yoga class to their exact needs. Booya!

Yes, that special someone can be you, too.

Please specify the recipient's details in the 'message to seller' at checkout, and then we will post out a personalised gift card. We can send it to you or straight to the lucky giftee.

name: Three in-home yoga classes

Please specify the recipient's details in the 'message to seller' at checkout, and then we will post out a personalised gift card. We can send it to you or straight to the lucky giftee.

name: Six in-home yoga classes
description:
For someone (or someones) you really love.

Six yoga classes, home delivered.

An awesome mm...Yoga! teacher will go to their home, at a time that suits them, and tailor a yoga class to their exact needs. Booya!

Perhaps you love yourself enough to commit to yoga in the New Year? This is a great way to start.

Please specify the recipient's details in the 'message to seller' at checkout, and then we will post out a personalised gift card. We can send it to you or straight to the lucky giftee.

name: yogAttitude DVD: strong * stretched * serene
description:
This DVD, filmed in beautiful Bali, released in January 2012.

You will end your practice feeling strong, stretched, and serene. Perfect for cultivating a yogAttitude to the rest of your life!

It's what my students call 'Nadine Yoga': breath focused, strong yet soft, and with my usual complement of inappropriate jokes.

All my favourite sequences and poses are included: the Pam Special, my unique brand of core strength (of course) and my favourite ever twist.

If you've been to a class with me in the last five years or so, you will know what I'm talking about. If not, you might have to get the DVD to find out!

This DVD contains:
*Two 30 minute practices: one a bit stronger than the other
*A core strength and balance sequence
*A kneeling, seated and reclining practice for those days when your energy is low but you still want to get your yoga on
